trans-unit.source: SQL Server Business Intelligence in Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Business Intelligence in Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the Business Intelligence (BI) features available for SQL Server running on Azure Virtual Machines (VMs).
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the Business Intelligence (BI) features available for SQL Server running on Azure Virtual Machines (VMs).

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Business Intelligence in Azure Virtual Machines
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Business Intelligence in Azure Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine gallery includes images that contain SQL Server installations.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine gallery includes images that contain SQL Server installations.

trans-unit.source: The SQL Server editions supported in the gallery images are the same installation files you can install to on-premises computers and virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Server editions supported in the gallery images are the same installation files you can install to on-premises computers and virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: This topic summarizes the SQL Server Business Intelligence (BI) Features installed on the images and configuration steps required after a virtual machine is provisioned.
trans-unit.target: This topic summarizes the SQL Server Business Intelligence (BI) Features installed on the images and configuration steps required after a virtual machine is provisioned.

trans-unit.source: This topic also describes supported deployment topologies for BI features and best practices.
trans-unit.target: This topic also describes supported deployment topologies for BI features and best practices.

trans-unit.source: License Considerations
trans-unit.target: License Considerations

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to license SQL Server in Microsoft Azure Virtual Machines:
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to license SQL Server in Microsoft Azure Virtual Machines:

trans-unit.source: License mobility benefits that are part of Software Assurance.
trans-unit.target: License mobility benefits that are part of Software Assurance.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>License Mobility through Software Assurance on Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>License Mobility through Software Assurance on Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Pay per hour rate of Azure Virtual Machines with SQL Server installed.
trans-unit.target: Pay per hour rate of Azure Virtual Machines with SQL Server installed.

trans-unit.source: See the “SQL Server” section in <link><linkText>Virtual Machines Pricing</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See the “SQL Server” section in <link><linkText>Virtual Machines Pricing</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For more information on licensing and current rates, see <link><linkText>Virtual Machines Licensing FAQ</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on licensing and current rates, see <link><linkText>Virtual Machines Licensing FAQ</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Images Available in Azure Virtual Machine Gallery
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Images Available in Azure Virtual Machine Gallery

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine gallery includes several images that contain Microsoft SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine gallery includes several images that contain Microsoft SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: The software installed on the virtual machine images varies based on the version of the operating system and the version of SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: The software installed on the virtual machine images varies based on the version of the operating system and the version of SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: The list of images available in the Azure virtual machine gallery changes frequently.
trans-unit.target: The list of images available in the Azure virtual machine gallery changes frequently.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL image in azure VM gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL image in azure VM gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>PowerShell</linkText> The following PowerShell script returns the list of Azure images that contain “SQL-Server” in the ImageName:

trans-unit.target: For more information on editions and features supported by SQL Server, see the following:

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>SQL Server Editions</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: General Recommendations and Best Practices
trans-unit.target: General Recommendations and Best Practices

trans-unit.source: The minimum recommended size for a virtual machine is A3 when using SQL Server Enterprise Edition.
trans-unit.target: The minimum recommended size for a virtual machine is A3 when using SQL Server Enterprise Edition.

trans-unit.source: The A4 virtual machine size is recommended for SQL Server BI deployments of Analysis Services and Reporting Services.
trans-unit.target: The A4 virtual machine size is recommended for SQL Server BI deployments of Analysis Services and Reporting Services.

trans-unit.source: For information on the current VM sizes, see <link><linkText>Virtual Machine Sizes for Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on the current VM sizes, see <link><linkText>Virtual Machine Sizes for Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: A best practice for disk management is to store data, log, and backup files on drives other than C: and D:.
trans-unit.target: A best practice for disk management is to store data, log, and backup files on drives other than C: and D:.

trans-unit.source: For example, create data disks E: and F:.
trans-unit.target: For example, create data disks E: and F:.

trans-unit.source: The drive caching policy for the default drive C: is not optimal for working with data.
trans-unit.target: The drive caching policy for the default drive C: is not optimal for working with data.

trans-unit.source: The D: drive is a temporary drive that is used primarily for the page file.
trans-unit.target: The D: drive is a temporary drive that is used primarily for the page file.

trans-unit.source: The D: drive is not persisted and is not saved in blob storage.
trans-unit.target: The D: drive is not persisted and is not saved in blob storage.

trans-unit.source: Management tasks such as a change to the virtual machine size reset the D: drive.
trans-unit.target: Management tasks such as a change to the virtual machine size reset the D: drive.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended to NOT use the D: drive for database files, including tempdb.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended to NOT use the D: drive for database files, including tempdb.

trans-unit.source: For more information on creating and attaching disks, see <link><linkText>How to Attach a Data Disk to a Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on creating and attaching disks, see <link><linkText>How to Attach a Data Disk to a Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Stop or uninstall services you do not plan to use.
trans-unit.target: Stop or uninstall services you do not plan to use.

trans-unit.source: For example if the virtual machine is only used for Reporting Services, stop or uninstall Analysis Services and SQL Server Integration Services.
trans-unit.target: For example if the virtual machine is only used for Reporting Services, stop or uninstall Analysis Services and SQL Server Integration Services.

trans-unit.source: The following image is an example of the services that are started by default.
trans-unit.target: The following image is an example of the services that are started by default.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Server services</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Server services</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The SQL Server database engine is required in the supported BI scenarios.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Server database engine is required in the supported BI scenarios.

trans-unit.source: In a single server VM topology, the database engine is required to be running on the same VM.
trans-unit.target: In a single server VM topology, the database engine is required to be running on the same VM.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following: <link><linkText>Uninstall Reporting Services</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Uninstall an Instance of Analysis Services</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following: <link><linkText>Uninstall Reporting Services</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Uninstall an Instance of Analysis Services</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Check Windows Update for new ‘Important updates’.
trans-unit.target: Check Windows Update for new ‘Important updates’.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine images are frequently refreshed; however important updates could become available from Windows Update after the VM image was last refreshed.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine images are frequently refreshed; however important updates could become available from Windows Update after the VM image was last refreshed.

trans-unit.source: Example Deployment Topologies
trans-unit.target: Example Deployment Topologies

trans-unit.source: The following are example deployments that use Microsoft Azure Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: The following are example deployments that use Microsoft Azure Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: The topologies in these diagrams are only some of the possible topologies you can use with SQL Server BI features and Microsoft Azure Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: The topologies in these diagrams are only some of the possible topologies you can use with SQL Server BI features and Microsoft Azure Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: Single Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: Single Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: Analysis Services, Reporting Services, SQL Server Database Engine, and data sources on a single virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Analysis Services, Reporting Services, SQL Server Database Engine, and data sources on a single virtual machine.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>bi iass scenario with 1 virtual machine</linkText>

trans-unit.target: Two Virtual Machines

trans-unit.source: Analysis Services, Reporting Services, and the SQL Server Database Engine on a single virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Analysis Services, Reporting Services, and the SQL Server Database Engine on a single virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This deployment includes the report server databases.
trans-unit.target: This deployment includes the report server databases.

trans-unit.target: Data sources on a second VM.

trans-unit.source: The second VM includes SQL Server Database Engine as a data source.
trans-unit.target: The second VM includes SQL Server Database Engine as a data source.

trans-unit.target: This deployment includes the report server databases.

trans-unit.source: In this example deployment Analysis Services, Reporting Services, and the SQL Server Database Engine run on a single virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: In this example deployment Analysis Services, Reporting Services, and the SQL Server Database Engine run on a single virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine hosts the report server databases.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine hosts the report server databases.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine is joined to an on-premises Domain through Azure Virtual Networking, or some other VPN tunneling solution.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine is joined to an on-premises Domain through Azure Virtual Networking, or some other VPN tunneling solution.

trans-unit.source: Reporting Services Native Mode Configuration
trans-unit.target: Reporting Services Native Mode Configuration

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine gallery image for SQL Server includes Reporting Services Native mode installed, however the report server is not configured.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine gallery image for SQL Server includes Reporting Services Native mode installed, however the report server is not configured.

trans-unit.source: The steps in this section configure the Reporting Services report server.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this section configure the Reporting Services report server.

trans-unit.source: For more detailed information on configuring Reporting Services Native mode, see <link><linkText>Install Reporting Services Native Mode Report Server (SSRS)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more detailed information on configuring Reporting Services Native mode, see <link><linkText>Install Reporting Services Native Mode Report Server (SSRS)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For similar content that uses Windows PowerShell scripts to configure the report server, see <link><linkText>Use PowerShell to Create an Azure VM With a Native Mode Report Server</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For similar content that uses Windows PowerShell scripts to configure the report server, see <link><linkText>Use PowerShell to Create an Azure VM With a Native Mode Report Server</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the Virtual Machine and Start the Reporting Services Configuration Manager
trans-unit.target: Connect to the Virtual Machine and Start the Reporting Services Configuration Manager

trans-unit.source: There are two common workflows for connecting to an Azure Virtual Machine:
trans-unit.target: There are two common workflows for connecting to an Azure Virtual Machine:

trans-unit.source: To connect in the , click the name of the virtual machine and then click Connect.
trans-unit.target: To connect in the , click the name of the virtual machine and then click Connect.

trans-unit.source: A Remote desktop connection opens and the computer name is automatically populated.
trans-unit.target: A Remote desktop connection opens and the computer name is automatically populated.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>connect to azure virtual machine</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>connect to azure virtual machine</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Connect to the virtual machine with Windows Remote Desktop Connection.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the virtual machine with Windows Remote Desktop Connection.

trans-unit.source: In the user interface of the remote desktop:
trans-unit.target: In the user interface of the remote desktop:

trans-unit.source: Type the cloud service name as the computer name.
trans-unit.target: Type the cloud service name as the computer name.

trans-unit.source: Type colon (:) and the public port number that is configured for the TCP remote desktop endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Type colon (:) and the public port number that is configured for the TCP remote desktop endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Myservice.cloudapp.net:63133
trans-unit.target: Myservice.cloudapp.net:63133

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>What is a cloud service?</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>What is a cloud service?</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Start Reporting Services Configuration Manager.
trans-unit.target: Start Reporting Services Configuration Manager.

trans-unit.source: In Windows Server 2012:
trans-unit.target: In Windows Server 2012:

trans-unit.source: From the Start screen, type Reporting Services to see a list of Apps.
trans-unit.target: From the Start screen, type Reporting Services to see a list of Apps.

trans-unit.source: Right-click Reporting Services Configuration Manager and click Run as Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Right-click Reporting Services Configuration Manager and click Run as Administrator.

trans-unit.source: In Windows Server 2008 R2:
trans-unit.target: In Windows Server 2008 R2:

trans-unit.source: Click Start, and then click ALL Programs.
trans-unit.target: Click Start, and then click ALL Programs.

trans-unit.source: Click Microsoft SQL Server 2012.
trans-unit.target: Click Microsoft SQL Server 2012.

trans-unit.source: Click Configuration Tools.
trans-unit.target: Click Configuration Tools.

trans-unit.source: Right-click Reporting Services Configuration Manager and click Run as Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Right-click Reporting Services Configuration Manager and click Run as Administrator.

trans-unit.source: Or
trans-unit.target: Or

trans-unit.source: Click Start.
trans-unit.target: Click Start.

trans-unit.source: In the Search programs and Files dialog type reporting services.
trans-unit.target: In the Search programs and Files dialog type reporting services.

trans-unit.source: If the VM is running Windows Server 2012, type reporting services on the Windows Server 2012 Start screen.
trans-unit.target: If the VM is running Windows Server 2012, type reporting services on the Windows Server 2012 Start screen.

trans-unit.source: Right-click Reporting Services Configuration Manager and click Run as Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Right-click Reporting Services Configuration Manager and click Run as Administrator.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>search for ssrs configuration manager</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>search for ssrs configuration manager</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configure Reporting Services
trans-unit.target: Configure Reporting Services

trans-unit.source: Service account and web service URL:
trans-unit.target: Service account and web service URL:

trans-unit.source: Verify the Server Name is the local server name and click Connect.
trans-unit.target: Verify the Server Name is the local server name and click Connect.

trans-unit.source: Note the blank Report Server Database Name.
trans-unit.target: Note the blank Report Server Database Name.

trans-unit.source: The database is created when the configuration completes.
trans-unit.target: The database is created when the configuration completes.

trans-unit.source: Verify the Report Server Status is Started.
trans-unit.target: Verify the Report Server Status is Started.

trans-unit.source: If you want to verify the service in Windows Server Manager, the service is the SQL Server Reporting Services Windows Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to verify the service in Windows Server Manager, the service is the SQL Server Reporting Services Windows Service.

trans-unit.source: Click Service Account and change the account as needed.
trans-unit.target: Click Service Account and change the account as needed.

trans-unit.source: If the virtual machine is used in a non-domain joined environment, the built-in ReportServer account is sufficient.
trans-unit.target: If the virtual machine is used in a non-domain joined environment, the built-in ReportServer account is sufficient.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the service account, see <link><linkText>Service Account</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on the service account, see <link><linkText>Service Account</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Click Web Service URL in the Left pane.
trans-unit.target: Click Web Service URL in the Left pane.

trans-unit.source: Click Apply to configure the default values.
trans-unit.target: Click Apply to configure the default values.

trans-unit.source: Note the Report Server Web Service URLs.
trans-unit.target: Note the Report Server Web Service URLs.

trans-unit.source: Note, the default TCP port is 80 and is part of the URL.
trans-unit.target: Note, the default TCP port is 80 and is part of the URL.

trans-unit.source: In a later step, you create a Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine Endpoint for the port.
trans-unit.target: In a later step, you create a Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine Endpoint for the port.

trans-unit.source: In the Results pane, verify the actions completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: In the Results pane, verify the actions completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: Database:
trans-unit.target: Database:

trans-unit.source: Click Database in the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Click Database in the left pane.

trans-unit.source: Click Change Database.
trans-unit.target: Click Change Database.

trans-unit.source: Verify Create a new report server database is selected and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Verify Create a new report server database is selected and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Verify Server Name and click Test Connection.
trans-unit.target: Verify Server Name and click Test Connection.

trans-unit.source: If the result is Test connection succeeded, click OK and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: If the result is Test connection succeeded, click OK and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Note the database name is ReportServer and the Report Server mode is Native then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Note the database name is ReportServer and the Report Server mode is Native then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Click Next on the Credentials page.
trans-unit.target: Click Next on the Credentials page.

trans-unit.source: Click Next on the Summary page.
trans-unit.target: Click Next on the Summary page.

trans-unit.source: Click Next on the Progress and Finish page.
trans-unit.target: Click Next on the Progress and Finish page.

trans-unit.source: Report Manager URL:
trans-unit.target: Report Manager URL:

trans-unit.source: Click Report Manager URL in the left pane.
trans-unit.target: Click Report Manager URL in the left pane.

trans-unit.source: Click Apply.
trans-unit.target: Click Apply.

trans-unit.source: In the Results pane, verify the actions completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: In the Results pane, verify the actions completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: Click Exit.
trans-unit.target: Click Exit.

trans-unit.source: For information on report server permissions, see <link><linkText>Granting Permissions on a Native Mode Report Server</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on report server permissions, see <link><linkText>Granting Permissions on a Native Mode Report Server</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the local Report Manager
trans-unit.target: Browse to the local Report Manager

trans-unit.source: To verify the configuration, browse to report manager on the VM.
trans-unit.target: To verify the configuration, browse to report manager on the VM.

trans-unit.source: On the VM, start Internet Explorer with administrator privileges.
trans-unit.target: On the VM, start Internet Explorer with administrator privileges.

trans-unit.source: Browse to http://localhost/reports on the VM.
trans-unit.target: Browse to http://localhost/reports on the VM.

trans-unit.source: To Connect to Remote Report Manager
trans-unit.target: To Connect to Remote Report Manager

trans-unit.source: If you want to connect to Report Manager on the virtual machine from a remote computer, create a new virtual machine TCP Endpoint.
trans-unit.target: If you want to connect to Report Manager on the virtual machine from a remote computer, create a new virtual machine TCP Endpoint.

trans-unit.source: By default, the report server listens for HTTP requests on port 80.
trans-unit.target: By default, the report server listens for HTTP requests on port 80.

trans-unit.source: If you configure the report server URLs to use a different port, you must specify that port number in the following instructions.
trans-unit.target: If you configure the report server URLs to use a different port, you must specify that port number in the following instructions.

trans-unit.source: Create an Endpoint for the Virtual Machine of TCP Port 80.
trans-unit.target: Create an Endpoint for the Virtual Machine of TCP Port 80.

trans-unit.source: For more information see, the <link><linkText>Virtual Machine Endpoints and Firewall Ports</linkText><title></title></link> section in this document.
trans-unit.target: For more information see, the <link><linkText>Virtual Machine Endpoints and Firewall Ports</linkText><title></title></link> section in this document.

trans-unit.source: Open port 80 in the virtual machine’s firewall.
trans-unit.target: Open port 80 in the virtual machine’s firewall.

trans-unit.source: Browse to report manager using Azure Virtual Machine DNS Name as the server name in the URL.
trans-unit.target: Browse to report manager using Azure Virtual Machine DNS Name as the server name in the URL.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Report manager: http://uebi.cloudapp.net/reportserver
trans-unit.target: Report manager: http://uebi.cloudapp.net/reportserver

trans-unit.source: Report server: http://uebi.cloudapp.net/reports
trans-unit.target: Report server: http://uebi.cloudapp.net/reports

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Configure a Firewall for Report Server Access</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Configure a Firewall for Report Server Access</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: To Create and Publish Reports to the Azure Virtual Machine
trans-unit.target: To Create and Publish Reports to the Azure Virtual Machine

trans-unit.source: The following table summarizes some of the options available to publish existing reports from an on-premises computer to the report server hosted on the Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine:
trans-unit.target: The following table summarizes some of the options available to publish existing reports from an on-premises computer to the report server hosted on the Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine:

trans-unit.source: Report Builder: The virtual machine includes the click-once version of Microsoft SQL Server Report Builder.
trans-unit.target: Report Builder: The virtual machine includes the click-once version of Microsoft SQL Server Report Builder.

trans-unit.source: To start Report builder the first time on the virtual machine:
trans-unit.target: To start Report builder the first time on the virtual machine:

trans-unit.source: Start your browser with administrative privileges.
trans-unit.target: Start your browser with administrative privileges.

trans-unit.source: Browse to report manager on the virtual machine and click Report Builder in the ribbon.
trans-unit.target: Browse to report manager on the virtual machine and click Report Builder in the ribbon.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Installing, Uninstalling, and Supporting Report Builder</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Installing, Uninstalling, and Supporting Report Builder</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Data Tools: VM: SQL Server Data Tools is installed on the virtual machine and can be used to create Report Server Projects and reports on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Data Tools: VM: SQL Server Data Tools is installed on the virtual machine and can be used to create Report Server Projects and reports on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Data Tools can publish the reports to the report server on the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Data Tools can publish the reports to the report server on the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Data Tools: Remote: On your local computer, create a Reporting Services project in SQL Server Data Tools that contains Reporting Services reports.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Data Tools: Remote: On your local computer, create a Reporting Services project in SQL Server Data Tools that contains Reporting Services reports.

trans-unit.source: Configure the project to connect to the web service URL.
trans-unit.target: Configure the project to connect to the web service URL.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>ssdt project properties for SSRS project</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>ssdt project properties for SSRS project</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Create a .VHD hard drive that contains reports and then upload and attach the drive.
trans-unit.target: Create a .VHD hard drive that contains reports and then upload and attach the drive.

trans-unit.source: Create a .VHD hard drive on your local computer that contains your reports.
trans-unit.target: Create a .VHD hard drive on your local computer that contains your reports.

trans-unit.source: Create and install a management certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create and install a management certificate.

trans-unit.source: Upload the VHD file to Azure using the Add-AzureVHD cmdlet <link><linkText>Create and upload a Windows Server VHD to Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Upload the VHD file to Azure using the Add-AzureVHD cmdlet <link><linkText>Create and upload a Windows Server VHD to Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Attach the disk to the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Attach the disk to the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Install other SQL Server Services and features
trans-unit.target: Install other SQL Server Services and features

trans-unit.source: To install additional SQL Server services, such as Analysis Services in tabular mode, run the SQL server setup wizard.
trans-unit.target: To install additional SQL Server services, such as Analysis Services in tabular mode, run the SQL server setup wizard.

trans-unit.source: The setup files are on the virtual machine’s local disk.
trans-unit.target: The setup files are on the virtual machine’s local disk.

trans-unit.source: Click Start and then click All Programs.
trans-unit.target: Click Start and then click All Programs.

trans-unit.source: Click Microsoft SQL Server 2014 or Microsoft SQL Server 2012 and then click Configuration Tools.
trans-unit.target: Click Microsoft SQL Server 2014 or Microsoft SQL Server 2012 and then click Configuration Tools.

trans-unit.source: Click SQL Server Installation Center.
trans-unit.target: Click SQL Server Installation Center.

trans-unit.source: Or run C:\SQLServer_12.0_full\setup.exe or C:\SQLServer_11.0_full\setup.exe
trans-unit.target: Or run C:\SQLServer_12.0_full\setup.exe or C:\SQLServer_11.0_full\setup.exe

trans-unit.source: The first time you run SQL Server setup, more setup files may be downloaded and require a reboot of the virtual machine and a restart of SQL Server setup.
trans-unit.target: The first time you run SQL Server setup, more setup files may be downloaded and require a reboot of the virtual machine and a restart of SQL Server setup.

trans-unit.source: If you need to repeatedly customize the image selected from the Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine, consider creating your own SQL Server image.
trans-unit.target: If you need to repeatedly customize the image selected from the Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine, consider creating your own SQL Server image.

trans-unit.source: Analysis Services SysPrep functionality was enabled with SQL Server 2012 SP1 CU2.
trans-unit.target: Analysis Services SysPrep functionality was enabled with SQL Server 2012 SP1 CU2.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Considerations for Installing SQL Server Using SysPrep</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Considerations for Installing SQL Server Using SysPrep</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To Install Analysis Services Tabular Mode
trans-unit.target: To Install Analysis Services Tabular Mode

trans-unit.source: The steps in this section summarize the installation of Analysis Services tabular mode.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this section summarize the installation of Analysis Services tabular mode.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Install Analysis Services in Tabular Mode</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Install Analysis Services in Tabular Mode</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Tabular Modeling (Adventure Works Tutorial)</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Tabular Modeling (Adventure Works Tutorial)</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: To Install Analysis Services Tabular Mode:
trans-unit.target: To Install Analysis Services Tabular Mode:

trans-unit.source: In the SQL Server installation wizard, click Installation in the left pane and then click New SQL server stand-alone installation or add features to an existing installation.
trans-unit.target: In the SQL Server installation wizard, click Installation in the left pane and then click New SQL server stand-alone installation or add features to an existing installation.

trans-unit.source: If you see the Browse For Folder, browse to c:\SQLServer_12.0_full or c:\SQLServer_11.0_full and then click Ok.
trans-unit.target: If you see the Browse For Folder, browse to c:\SQLServer_12.0_full or c:\SQLServer_11.0_full and then click Ok.

trans-unit.source: Click Next on the product updates page.
trans-unit.target: Click Next on the product updates page.

trans-unit.source: On the Installation Type page, select Perform a new installation of SQL Server and click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Installation Type page, select Perform a new installation of SQL Server and click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Setup Role page, click SQL Server Features Installation.
trans-unit.target: On the Setup Role page, click SQL Server Features Installation.

trans-unit.source: On the Feature Selection page, click Analysis Services.
trans-unit.target: On the Feature Selection page, click Analysis Services.

trans-unit.source: On the Instance Configuration page, type a descriptive name, such as Tabular into Named Instance and Instance Id text boxes.
trans-unit.target: On the Instance Configuration page, type a descriptive name, such as Tabular into Named Instance and Instance Id text boxes.

trans-unit.source: On the Analysis Services Configuration page, select Tabular Mode.
trans-unit.target: On the Analysis Services Configuration page, select Tabular Mode.

trans-unit.source: Add the current user to the administrative permissions list.
trans-unit.target: Add the current user to the administrative permissions list.

trans-unit.source: Complete and close the SQL Server installation wizard.
trans-unit.target: Complete and close the SQL Server installation wizard.

trans-unit.source: Analysis Services Configuration
trans-unit.target: Analysis Services Configuration

trans-unit.source: Remote Access to Analysis Services Server
trans-unit.target: Remote Access to Analysis Services Server

trans-unit.source: Analysis Services server only supports windows authentication.
trans-unit.target: Analysis Services server only supports windows authentication.

trans-unit.source: To access Analysis Services remotely from client applications such as SQL Server Management Studio or SQL Server Data Tools, the virtual machine needs to be joined to your local domain, using Azure Virtual Networking.
trans-unit.target: To access Analysis Services remotely from client applications such as SQL Server Management Studio or SQL Server Data Tools, the virtual machine needs to be joined to your local domain, using Azure Virtual Networking.

trans-unit.source: For more information see, <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Network</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information see, <link><linkText>Azure Virtual Network</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: A default instance of Analysis Services listens on TCP port 2383.
trans-unit.target: A default instance of Analysis Services listens on TCP port 2383.

trans-unit.source: Open the port in the virtual machines firewall.
trans-unit.target: Open the port in the virtual machines firewall.

trans-unit.source: A clustered named instance of Analysis Services also listens on port 2383.
trans-unit.target: A clustered named instance of Analysis Services also listens on port 2383.

trans-unit.source: For a named instance of Analysis Services, the SQL Server Browser service is required to manage port access.
trans-unit.target: For a named instance of Analysis Services, the SQL Server Browser service is required to manage port access.

trans-unit.source: The SQL Server Browser default configuration is port 2382.
trans-unit.target: The SQL Server Browser default configuration is port 2382.

trans-unit.source: In the virtual machines firewall, open port 2382 and create a static Analysis Services named instance port.
trans-unit.target: In the virtual machines firewall, open port 2382 and create a static Analysis Services named instance port.

trans-unit.source: To verify ports that are already in use on the VM and what process is using the ports, run the following command with administrative privileges:
trans-unit.target: To verify ports that are already in use on the VM and what process is using the ports, run the following command with administrative privileges:

trans-unit.source: Use SQL Server Management Studio to create a static Analysis Services named instance port by updating 'Port' value in tabular AS instance general properties.
trans-unit.target: Use SQL Server Management Studio to create a static Analysis Services named instance port by updating 'Port' value in tabular AS instance general properties.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the “Use a fixed port for a default or named instance” in <link><linkText>Configure the Windows Firewall to Allow Analysis Services Access</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the “Use a fixed port for a default or named instance” in <link><linkText>Configure the Windows Firewall to Allow Analysis Services Access</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Restart the tabular instance of the Analysis Services service.
trans-unit.target: Restart the tabular instance of the Analysis Services service.

trans-unit.source: For more information see, the Virtual Machine Endpoints and Firewall Ports section in this document.
trans-unit.target: For more information see, the Virtual Machine Endpoints and Firewall Ports section in this document.

trans-unit.source: Virtual Machine Endpoints and Firewall Ports
trans-unit.target: Virtual Machine Endpoints and Firewall Ports

trans-unit.source: This section summarizes Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine Endpoints to create and ports to open in the virtual machine firewalls.
trans-unit.target: This section summarizes Microsoft Azure Virtual Machine Endpoints to create and ports to open in the virtual machine firewalls.

trans-unit.source: The following table summarizes the TCP ports to create endpoints for and the ports to open in the virtual machines firewall.
trans-unit.target: The following table summarizes the TCP ports to create endpoints for and the ports to open in the virtual machines firewall.

trans-unit.source: If you are using a single VM and the following two items are true, you do not need to create VM endpoints and you do not need to open the ports in the firewall on the VM.
trans-unit.target: If you are using a single VM and the following two items are true, you do not need to create VM endpoints and you do not need to open the ports in the firewall on the VM.

trans-unit.source: You do not remotely connect to the SQL Server features on the VM.
trans-unit.target: You do not remotely connect to the SQL Server features on the VM.

trans-unit.source: Establishing a remote desktop connection to the VM and accessing the SQL Server features locally on the VM is not considered a remote connection to the SQL Server features.
trans-unit.target: Establishing a remote desktop connection to the VM and accessing the SQL Server features locally on the VM is not considered a remote connection to the SQL Server features.

trans-unit.source: You do not join the VM to an on-premises domain through Azure Virtual Networking or another VPN tunneling solution.
trans-unit.target: You do not join the VM to an on-premises domain through Azure Virtual Networking or another VPN tunneling solution.

trans-unit.source: If the virtual machine is not joined to a domain but you want to remotely connect to the SQL Server features on VM:
trans-unit.target: If the virtual machine is not joined to a domain but you want to remotely connect to the SQL Server features on VM:

trans-unit.source: Open the ports in the firewall on the VM.
trans-unit.target: Open the ports in the firewall on the VM.

trans-unit.source: Create virtual machine Endpoints for the noted ports (*).
trans-unit.target: Create virtual machine Endpoints for the noted ports (*).

trans-unit.source: If the virtual machine is joined to a domain using a VPN tunnel such as Azure Virtual Networking, then the endpoints are not required.
trans-unit.target: If the virtual machine is joined to a domain using a VPN tunnel such as Azure Virtual Networking, then the endpoints are not required.

trans-unit.source: However open the ports in the firewall on the VM.
trans-unit.target: However open the ports in the firewall on the VM.

trans-unit.target: Port

trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.target: 80

trans-unit.target: TCP

trans-unit.source: Report server Remote access (*).
trans-unit.target: Report server Remote access (*).

trans-unit.source: 1433
trans-unit.target: 1433

trans-unit.source: TCP
trans-unit.target: TCP

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Management Studio (*).
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Management Studio (*).

trans-unit.target: 1434

trans-unit.source: UDP
trans-unit.target: UDP

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Browser.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Browser.

trans-unit.source: This is needed when the VM in joined to a domain.
trans-unit.target: This is needed when the VM in joined to a domain.

trans-unit.source: 2382
trans-unit.target: 2382

trans-unit.source: TCP
trans-unit.target: TCP

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Browser.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Browser.

trans-unit.target: 2383

trans-unit.source: TCP
trans-unit.target: TCP

trans-unit.source: SQL Server Analysis Services default instance and clustered named instances.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server Analysis Services default instance and clustered named instances.

trans-unit.source: User defined
trans-unit.target: User defined

trans-unit.source: TCP
trans-unit.target: TCP

trans-unit.source: Create a static Analysis Services named instance port for a port number you choose, and then unblock the port number in the firewall.
trans-unit.target: Create a static Analysis Services named instance port for a port number you choose, and then unblock the port number in the firewall.

trans-unit.source: For more information on creating endpoints, see the following:
trans-unit.target: For more information on creating endpoints, see the following:

trans-unit.source: Create Endpoints:<link><linkText>How to Set Up Endpoints to a Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Create Endpoints:<link><linkText>How to Set Up Endpoints to a Virtual Machine</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server: See the “Complete Configuration steps to connect to the virtual machine Using SQL Server Management Studio” section of <link><linkText>Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server: See the “Complete Configuration steps to connect to the virtual machine Using SQL Server Management Studio” section of <link><linkText>Provisioning a SQL Server Virtual Machine on Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
